ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: NHS South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: NHS South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit

TITLE.P: Provision of Sexual Assault Referral Centres (SARCs) across the South West.

SHORT_DESCR.P: This prior information notice is placed to inform the market about a forthcoming provider engagement event, in relation to Sexual Assault Referral Centre (SARC) provision across the South West.

NHS England South (South West) are looking to re-commission SARC services for both adults and paediatrics across the South West, covering the four Police Force boundaries of Avon and Somerset, Gloucestershire, Wiltshire and Swindon and Devon and Cornwall. The procurement is likely to commence late August 2017. There are currently seven SARCs across the South West with considerable variation in service provision, not only with regards to the age and needs of service users but also to activity, service specification and referral pathways. The procurement exercise will aim to increase equity of access to SARC provision and ensure a consistent and high standard of quality care to victims of sexual assault in line with Specification No 30.
NHS England would like to determine the potential level of provider interest from all sectors (including voluntary and third sector) in preparation for hosting a provider engagement event in June.

If you are interested in attending the provider event and in the procurement of SARCs, please register on In-Tend and express an interest in the relevant project, where you will find a provider sounding questionnaire for completion.
Please complete the questionnaire and return via In-Tend by 12:00 midday on Friday 2.6.2017.
Interested providers will be able to view the provider market event opportunity via the ‘current tenders’ list on in-tend.
Or you should be able to go directly to this particular opportunity by following the link below:

INFO_ADD.P: It must be noted that this procurement does not include the ‘Sexual Offences Examiners’ contract.

This notice is an information gathering exercise rather than a call for competition in its own right, and therefore publication or response does not commit NHS England or respondents to a future procurement, nor provide any process exemptions or preferential treatment to any parties expressing an interest. NHS England will not be liable for costs incurred by any interested party in participating in this exercise.

The Services are healthcare services within the meaning and scope of Annex XIV of Directive 2014/24/EU (‘the Directive’) and Schedule 3 to the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (‘the Regulations’), which are not subject to the full regime of the Regulations, but is instead governed by the ‘Light Touch Regime’, (Articles 74 to 76 of the Directive, and Regulations 74 to 76 of the Regulations).
